Environmental Engineer Associate A unique opportunity to support a technology-centered new business venture in environmental intelligence that evolves from a proven intelligence team. By leveraging satellite technologies and proprietary analytics, we create innovative product and platform solutions that transform industries through the use of direct measurement to create unimpeachable environmental intelligence. This role will support research related to the new business venture, helping to translate strategic thinking into execution plans with key markets of opportunity. This position provides an opportunity to work with a small team focused on analytics and intelligence for commercial applications. Specific activities are likely to include research and analysis of open source and geospatial data to understand its applicability to industries of interest, particularly environmental intelligence, greenhouse gas monitoring, energy and energy transition, metals, and other asset monitoring. Ideal candidates will have demonstrated intellectual curiosity, interpersonal skills, and an ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment. Candidates may have a wide variety of backgrounds in school and experience, but a background in environmental science is desired. What You’ll Do: Satellite imagery processing/analysis. Technical data gathering and analysis from proprietary, commercial, and public sources. Statistical analysis. Market analysis. Maintain a regular and predictable work schedule. Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the Strategic Business Units, Strategic Capabilities Units and the Company. Interact appropriately with others in order to maintain a positive and productive work environment. Perform other duties as necessary. What You’ll Need: BS degree or higher in Engineering or related technical field is required. Each higher-level degree, i.e., Master’s Degree or Ph.D., may substitute for two years of experience. Related technical experience may be considered in lieu of education. Degree must be from a university, college, or school which is accredited by an agency recognized by the US Secretary of Education, US Department of Education. Environmental Science degree preferred. Excellent interpersonal skills and intellectual curiosity required. Foreign language skills a major plus. Experience with Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint, Google Slides and Sheets Data analysis skills a plus. Experience with different data analysis tools (Python, Tableau, etc.) is a plus. Flex Work Environment: This position may be performed from a Ball location for the minority of time (e.g., working from both the office location and another location, and typically in the office less than three days in a normally scheduled week). Travel and local commute between Ball campuses and other possible non-Ball locations may be required.
